title: What are moral and non-moral actions? - Quora

response.answer_text: Morality implies right and wrong. And right and wrong imply standards by which actions are categorized. It also implies teleology to actions. That is, all actions have an end or a purpose in mind. Western cultural morality evolved from Judeo-Christian culture and history. The standards by which actions are judged evolved in the stories of God’s interactions with His chosen people, most forcefully in the 10 Comandments. Western society has made several attempts to cast off Judeo-Christian morality. This was noted by Nietsche when he stated that “God is dead; we have killed him.” Neitsche wondered whether humans were capable of creating their own values (morality) outside of the type of evolution documented in the Bible. He predicted that it would be a very bloody process to do so; and he was right. Humanity has yet to witness the genesis of secular morality without intense suffering. But many are still trying.

Religion nonsense represents the great number of hits which is its own irony.  Nonmoral actions or events: those areas of interest where moral categories cannot be applied. ... such a kind as to be evil, sinful, or wrong according to some code or theory of ethics. Lander University P.S. Don't put to much into play with the term sinful because this Biblical term suggests that an evil or sinful act of God is all that can save us from the said same.
